intro: Mammillaria mainiae, commonly known as the Mainia's hedgehog cactus, is a species native to the arid regions of Mexico. It is a small, globular cactus with a dense covering of white to pale yellow spines. The plant typically grows to a height of about 5 to 10 centimeters, with a short, thick stem. Its flowers are usually pale yellow or white, appearing in late spring or early summer. Mammillaria mainiae is well adapted to dry climates and requires minimal water once established.
